node.category: What is the way things are?
Is it fair of landlords to raise the rent when a new tenant moves in?

node.surface: It is unfair and unjustifiable that new tenants have to pay a much higher rent than previous residents.

node.category: Could an increase in the rent be justified?

node.surface: Clearly the landlord has to pay for some repairs before a new lease.

node.category: So could the rent be raised strongly when a new tenant moves in?

node.surface: But surely these costs could be covered by a minimal increase in rent over the course of the entire lease.
All the more so as for an adequate profit the rental rate as compared to the base rent need not be raised for every new lease.
